page.title: 02Multicultural North Coventry
page.content: The religion of the area includes the Christianity of the indigenous population , of the West Indies and of Eastern Europe. There are others including the Asian religions of Hinduism, Sikhism and Islam. Schools attempt to provide multicultural education and mother tongue language teaching in Gujerati, Punjabi, Hindi and Urdu. There are primary and secondary schools and community colleges. The colleges reflect social concern for the area.Many West Indian and Asian children attend weekend schools to preserve their religions and cultures.The population also includes many Chinese. Shops serving the needs of the mixed population are in all areas as are Italian, Chinese, Turkish and Indian restaurants, as well as those serving English food.
